Staying at the Firetower was an unforgettable experience. The silence of the seclusion mixed with the gorgeous setting with a warm, cozy, and perfect base was an experience I had never anticipated.
Chris's listing and messages had let us know ahead of time that we would most likely need a car with AWD to get to the chalet. Unfortunately, the car we planned to borrow fell through at the last second and we decided to risk it.... we did not make it farther than the farm house in my tiny coup.
LUCKILY Chris was incredibly responsive to my messages, and allowed us to borrow a truck that had been parked right there. After moving our things to the truck and making our way up, we were pretty cold but in high spirits. The moment we turned the corner and saw the firetower in person, we were in a new world.
Stepping inside, the tower was already so warm and inviting. We left our things in the car for a few minutes just to enjoy the space. When we made our way upstairs, the bed faces an all window/door wall with views over the mountains. It absolutely took my breath away. We came and stayed while it was snowing and cold, and I spent a significant amount of my time walking the 360 deck just having my breath taken away.
The firetower had everything we needed and more. We had brought half our kitchen and appliances with us, which turned out to be completely unnecessary. Everything was well stocked with cooking ingredients, games to play, supplies, and so many odds and ends that ended up coming in handy (that ball of string came in clutch!).
My partner and I had an absolutely rejuvenating experience staying here, and we hope to continue to return for years to come.
